pull.title: build: add `standard branch-protection` to hardening flags for aarch64-linux
pull.body:
Use `-mbranch-protection=standard` when targetting `*aarch64-*-linux*`.
Part of #24123, but this flag can already be used on a best effort basis.

Note that this flag is also already used by default, in the toolchain, on various distros (i.e Fedora).

verification.payload:
tree d509effe00ab244616f00b1d42fadd4f28b658ef
parent 338bc2cd261ba3daf7fb494f8cb4a534762e292c
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1710945581 +0000
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1724839236 +0100

build: use standard branch-protection for aarch64-linux

events.message: build: use standard branch-protection for aarch64-linux

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -861,7 +861,11 @@ if test "$use_hardening" != "no"; then
   esac
 
   case $host in
-    *aarch64*)
+    *aarch64-*-linux*)
+      AX_CHECK_COMPILE_FLAG([-mbranch-protection=standard], [HARDENED_CXXFLAGS="$HARDENED_CXXFLAGS -mbranch-protection=standard"])
comments.body: Will this override the user if he sets a stronger mode?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -861,7 +861,11 @@ if test "$use_hardening" != "no"; then
   esac
 
   case $host in
-    *aarch64*)
+    *aarch64-*-linux*)
+      AX_CHECK_COMPILE_FLAG([-mbranch-protection=standard], [HARDENED_CXXFLAGS="$HARDENED_CXXFLAGS -mbranch-protection=standard"])
+      AX_CHECK_LINK_FLAG([-Wl,-z,pac-plt], [HARDENED_LDFLAGS="$HARDENED_LDFLAGS -Wl,-z,pac-plt"], [], [$LDFLAG_WERROR])

@@ -861,7 +861,11 @@ if test "$use_hardening" != "no"; then
   esac
 
   case $host in
-    *aarch64*)
+    *aarch64-*-linux*)
+      AX_CHECK_COMPILE_FLAG([-mbranch-protection=standard], [HARDENED_CXXFLAGS="$HARDENED_CXXFLAGS -mbranch-protection=standard"])
comments.body: The same logic as all other flags applies, the user has the final say.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -861,7 +861,11 @@ if test "$use_hardening" != "no"; then
   esac
 
   case $host in
-    *aarch64*)
+    *aarch64-*-linux*)
+      AX_CHECK_COMPILE_FLAG([-mbranch-protection=standard], [HARDENED_CXXFLAGS="$HARDENED_CXXFLAGS -mbranch-protection=standard"])
+      AX_CHECK_LINK_FLAG([-Wl,-z,pac-plt], [HARDENED_LDFLAGS="$HARDENED_LDFLAGS -Wl,-z,pac-plt"], [], [$LDFLAG_WERROR])
comments.body: I'll take a look, and we can backport something if relevant.
